link.title: Resources during Coronavirus (COVID-19) Emergency › Poe Center for Health Education ‹ Poe Center for Health Education
Poe Center for Health Education » Feed

div.h4: Hopefully, your family has the flexibility to shelter at home during this emergency and practice physical distancing. Thank you! That’s the responsible thing to do! But it’s not easy.
div.p: The Poe Center is here to help. We have compiled a list of our best educational, fun, and useful resources along with local and state-wide information to help you stay active, healthy – and sane – during this unprecedented time.

em.span: This information is current as of 4/22/2020 and will be updated as needed. Information is subject to change as the current states-of-emergency develops.

li.a: Sign Up to get this info via email!

h3.strong: Access to Food, and Cooking Resources:

ul.li: Food Resources (Wake County): This list includes a map of food resources, a map of food pantries, school sites for food, and more.
Text for Food Access: Parents can text to find out about food sites for kids.

li.span: Dr. Yum: Cook with what you have at home using this handy tool. Select the ingredients you already have and follow the recipe.

li.a: Carolina Farm Stewardship’s interactive map for on-farm pickups and pre-orders
Triangle Area Farmers Market Facebook Group.

li.span: to help the community during Coronavirus.
A non-profit organization that provides hunger relief to children in Chapel Hill, Carrboro, and neighboring Orange County communities.

ul.li: Food resources for Orange County students and families.

ChopChop Kids Club Newsletter – Subscribers receive ChopChop cooking magazine’s latest and greatest range of resources, including a selection of pantry-based recipes, engaging and educational activities and games, and relevant step-by-step cooking skills to practice and master.

li.span: Free Internet from Spectrum for students who are learning online (offer valid for a 60-day free period).

div.p: Looking for resources to continue health education at home? Try these resources courtesy of the Poe Center:

ul.li: Curriculum Pathways Lessons – Integrate Poe’s creative health lessons into your home activities.

span.span: Visit one of Poe’s beautifully designed online exhibits. Each website features dozens of informative hotspots covering a wide range of health-science topics, including kitchen safety and skills, gardening education, medicine safety, and health history.

ul.li: Poe’s Classroom Calendar: Poe’s yearly Nutrition and Physical Activity Calendar is full of healthy eating and active lifestyle tips, activities, games, recipes, and more.
Family-Friendly Recipes: Have fun with your kids in the kitchen using recipes that Poe uses in our cooking programs.
GrowWELL Garden Coloring Page: Put your own creative spin on Poe’s popular garden mural.

li.span: Check out Poe’s YouTube Channel to watch our quick, fun videos all about the food groups, healthy eating, and staying active.

span.style: display: inline-block; width: 0px; overflow: hidden; line-height: 0;

li.span: How to shop smart on a budget.
Originally written for the holiday season, this blog entry is full of tips to manage stressful situations.
: How to make sure medications, firearms, alcohol, and other in-home dangers are secured.
Stay healthy while snacking at home.

ul.li: For the Love of Vegetables: Cooking at home? Now’s a great time to explore new veggies, fresh or canned.
Keeping Kids Active While Indoors – Originally written for cold and snowy days, this article has great indoor games and activities for toddlers – high schoolers.
Food Safety During COVID-19: 9 Tips for Handling Food Safely: Wondering how to safely grocery shop, prepare food, and eat during the Coronavirus Emergency? Learn more in this helpful post.

Pass the “Quarantini:” When Alcohol Consumption Meets Social Distancing: How much is too much alcohol? In honor of National Alcohol Awareness Month, we explore the phenomenon of drinking to cure boredom during quarantine.

div.p: Did you know you can search a database of #PoeFit tweets for anything related to healthy eating, active lifestyles, and gardening! Try searching our #PoeFit Database for these terms: “at home” “easy” “quick” “snack” “game” “indoors” “stay active” “moving” “move.”

blockquote.p: How can we both help curb the spread of #coronavirus through “social distancing” AND continue to eat healthy? One option is to purchase nutritious #nonperishable foods, like frozen #fruits and #vegetables. Read more benefits of using frozen produce: https://t.co/NU5ot45q1B pic.twitter.com/npBhfjg10M

p.br: Check out our main Twitter account for #PoePrevention Tweets too. Our Substance Use Prevention educators publish a weekly series that deals with mental health, mindfulness, deep breathing exercises, protective factors, and more.

ul.li: Suggestions for Caregivers: How to help kids cope with this unique situation.

Helpful Websites for Parents: From explaining COVID-19 to youth with autism, to managing stress, to balancing working from home with caregiving, this list has tons of resources for parents/caregivers.
Mindfulness Moment: Preferred Place: Grab a yoga mat, chair, or cushion and practice mindfulness with Poe Center Health Educator Rebecca.
Loving Kindness Mantra: Practice kindness and enjoy a few mindful moments with Rebecca.
Mindfulness Moment: Breath Loop: Practice mindfulness with Rebecca.
How to Care for Yourself While Physical Distancing: Coping with depression and anxiety, helping others with mental health concerns, and tips for self-care from our friends at Mental Health First Aid.

span.a: National Alliance for Mental Illness resource guide for COVID-19

a.span: National Alliance for Mental Illness: How to Ease Children’s Anxiety about COVID-19

ul.li: Why Playgrounds Are So Important and Why You Should Avoid Them Now: From our friends at Kaboom, an explanation of why our PlayWELL Park and other parks are closed temporarily.
Resources for schools and families: From Action for Healthy Kids

a.span: Healthy activities to do at home:

ul.li: Live Recess with Playworks: Check out Playworks’ Facebook Page as they go LIVE for “Recess” every day at Noon, 2:00 p.m., and 4:00 p.m. (Eastern Time). Tune in for stretching and warm-ups, interactive games, cheers, and cooldown activities.
Helpline Services for Substance Use Care & Treatment Challenges from Partnership for Drug-Free Kids

Youth and Social Media Webinar: A resource for parents. Learn about current research on adolescent brain development and teen risk perception. This webinar will explore how a risk perception impacts a teen’s engagement with social media and Internet security.

li.span: : Free exercises for seniors from the National Institute on Aging.
Download this PDF all about strength training for families. Build up your muscular strength and endurance! Plus, it’s a fun way to exercise with minimal equipment and space.
Planting Calendar from Farmer’s Almanac: Learn how to plant your own edible garden and when to start.
from Registered Dietitians related to COVID-19 from Produce for Better Health.
Daily Newsletter for activities and tips you can use to help kids learn at home.

li.a: Mask information, DIY Mask instructions, and more from the CDC

ul.li: The HIVE: Learn more about the wonderful world of bees and how important they are to our planet. Our friends at Bee Downtown have created a free virtual platform called THE HIVE which is full of activities for kids like coloring pages of hive designs, arts and crafts, honey themed recipes for family baking sessions, virtual hive tours and beekeeping lessons, and so much more.

Donate to the Poe Center – As a leader in health education, illness prevention has been a core message in the Poe Center’s programs since our inception in 1991. We’ve taught thousands of children and families the value of proper handwashing and how to bust germs. Although our doors are currently closed, staff are working hard to create online programs so we may continue to deliver these important and timely messages to classrooms around the state remotely. Please consider a donation to the Poe Center at this time so that we may continue to educate NC families on how to keep themselves healthy during this national crisis.
Activate Good has a list of ways you can volunteer to support Triangle organizations during the COVD-19 crisis.
A guide to support local food systems during COVID-19.
10 Ways to Safely Help Your Community During COVID-19 (Americorps)
